raw.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet Interest Rate Recommendation for WETH
raw.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02
raw.body:
## Summary

A proposal to make parameter changes on Ethereum v3 and v2, Optimism v3, Arbitrum v3, Polygon v3. For more details, see the full forum post [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/gauntlet-interest-rate-recommendations-for-weth-and-wmatic-on-v2-and-v3/14588/7).

## Motivation
Gauntlet’s analysis has identified opportunities to adjust interest rate parameters for WETH on Ethereum v3, Optimism v3, Arbitrum v3, Polygon v3. This will help to facilitate more Emode borrowing against LST collateral, which may
- drive additional revenue to Aave. 
- adjust current risk profile for LST to depend less on onchain liquidity, which has been steadily declining over the past few months. This may be adding risk to the current borrow composition against LST collateral.


## Specification

| Option | Description | Recommendation
| --- | ---|  ---| 
| 1 | Lower slope 1 below staking yield | Lower slope 1 on all v3 to 3.3%  | 
| 2 | Match v3 Ethereum | Remove base rate of 1% on all v3, excl Ethereum v3 | 
| 3 | Not recommended | No change| 

**Disclaimer: Gauntlet reserves the right to not move forward with any parameter changes recommended in Snapshot polls, if market conditions change meaningfully.**

*By approving this proposal, you agree that any services provided by Gauntlet shall be governed by the terms of service available at gauntlet.network/tos.*

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet Recommendations to Lower stMATIC/MaticX non-emode LT/LTV on Polygon v3
cleaned.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02

raw.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet Recommendations to Lower stMATIC/MaticX non-emode LT/LTV on Polygon v3
raw.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02
raw.body:
## Summary

A proposal to make parameter changes on Polygon Aave v3. For more details and analysis, see the full forum post [here]( https://governance.aave.com/t/arfc-gauntlet-recommendation-to-lower-stmatic-maticx-non-emode-lt/14859 ).


## Motivation

Gauntlet recommends lowering stMATIC, MaticX non-emode LT to improve the risk profile associated with MATIC LSTs.

Reducing MATIC LST non-emode LT to lower borrowing power can help combat the following.

- Risks of reduced WMATIC supply in the future, which may cause long-term growth risk for Polygon v3
- Risks of reduced capacity for recursive LST - WMATIC borrowing
- Risks associated with increased stablecoin borrowing against LST collateral, amidst decreasing MATIC LST liquidity


## Specification

| Option | stMATIC LT changes | MaticX LT changes| stMATIC LTV changes | MaticX LTV changes |
|--------|------|---------------------| ---| ---|
| 1      | 0.65 -> 0.60  | 0.67 -> 0.62 | 0.50 -> 0.45 | 0.58 -> 0.45|
| 2      | 0.65 -> 0.56 | 0.67 -> 0.58  | 0.50 -> 0.40 | 0.58 -> 0.40|
| 3 | no change |no change |no change |no change |


**Disclaimer: Gauntlet reserves the right to not move forward with any parameter changes recommended in Snapshot polls, if market conditions change meaningfully.**

*By approving this proposal, you agree that any services provided by Gauntlet shall be governed by the terms of service available at gauntlet.network/tos.*

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet recommendation for WETH Uopt on Ethereum v3
cleaned.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02

raw.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet recommendation for WETH Uopt on Ethereum v3
raw.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02
raw.body:
## Summary

A proposal to make parameter changes on Ethereum v3. For more details, see the full forum post [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/gauntlet-recommendation-for-weth-uopt-on-ethereum-v3/14802).


## Motivation

[AIP-306](https://app.aave.com/governance/proposal/306/) to onboard sDAI also increased WETH Uopt from 80% to 90%. After analysis, Gauntlet recommends returning WETH Uopt to 80%. Currently, there may be insufficient WETH to facilitate liquidations during increased volatility - this proposal aims to increase the available WETH for liquidations should utilization for WETH be at Uopt = kink.


## Specification


| Option | New WETH Uopt for Ethereum v3 |
| --- | ---| 
| 1 | 0.8 | 
| 2 | 0.85 | 
| 3 | 0.9 (no change) |




**Disclaimer: Gauntlet reserves the right to not move forward with any parameter changes recommended in Snapshot polls, if market conditions change meaningfully.**

*By approving this proposal, you agree that any services provided by Gauntlet shall be governed by the terms of service available at gauntlet.network/tos.*

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet Recommendation on TUSD for Aave v2 Ethereum

raw.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet Recommendation on TUSD for Aave v2 Ethereum
raw.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02
raw.body:
## Summary

A proposal to make parameter changes on TUSD for Aave v2 Ethereum. For more details, see the full forum post [here]( https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-gauntlet-recommendation-on-tusd-for-aave-v2-ethereum/13727).


## Motivation

If the community views TUSD as having excess counterparty risk, we recommend iteratively lowering LT, LTV and/or freezing TUSD supply to begin off-boarding TUSD.


## Specification

This is a poll to gauge the community's preference:
- Option 1: iteratively lowering the LT of TUSD to 77.5%, LTV to 75%.
- Option 2: Freeze TUSD supply.
- Abstain
- Nay

Because these two options are not mutually exclusive, this is a multi-select poll so that community members can select multiple options. 


**Disclaimer: Gauntlet reserves the right to not move forward with any parameter changes recommended in Snapshot polls, if market conditions change meaningfully.**

*By approving this proposal, you agree that any services provided by Gauntlet shall be governed by the terms of service available at gauntlet.network/tos.*

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet - Synchronicity Price Adapter “Killswitch” Functionality for LST Emode
cleaned.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02

raw.title: [ARFC] Gauntlet - Synchronicity Price Adapter “Killswitch” Functionality for LST Emode
raw.author: 0x683a4F9915D6216f73d6Df50151725036bD26C02
raw.body:
## Summary

Given limitations in the current CSPA 2.0, Aave v3 faces insolvency risks in the scenario of severe price dislocations between LST market price and LST smart contract price. Gauntlet proposes a “killswitch” functionality for LST Emode in the face of an LST depeg. See the full forum post [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/gauntlet-synchronicity-price-adapter-killswitch-functionality-for-lst-emode/13224).


## Motivation

To further improve on CSPA 2.0, Gauntlet recommends that the Aave protocol limit LST borrowing power when abnormal dislocations occur. This can prevent bad agents from taking advantage of extreme market conditions to create insolvencies on Aave. We provide the options below as a "killswitch" functionality for LST Emode in the face of an LST depeg. 

## Specification
We provide 4 levers (A, B, C, D) that can be pulled in the event of a depeg. Please find more details on each lever in the [forum post](https://governance.aave.com/t/gauntlet-synchronicity-price-adapter-killswitch-functionality-for-lst-emode/13224/8?u=gauntlet). 

We provide the following set of options to the community.

|  | Market / Smart Contract depeg protection | Market / Smart Contract depeg protection | Liquidity decrease triggered protection | Liquidity decrease triggered protection |
|--------|-----------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------|----------------------------------------|----------------------------------------|
| Option | Lever A - dynamic, automated LT reduction | Lever B - freeze LST + LTV -> 0 | Lever C - double slope 1 of BASE | Lever D - lower LTV to non emode LST params |
| 1 (Gauntlet choice) | x | x | x | x |
| 2 | x | x | | |
| 3 | | x | |  |
| 4 (NAY - no killswitch) | | | | |


This is a poll to gauge the community's preference:
- Option 1: Lever A, B, C, D
- Option 2: Lever A, B
- Option 3: Lever B
- Option 4: Nay - no killswitch
- Abstain

Following community preference, we will work on the next steps in the implementation phase and will keep the community closely informed.

**Disclaimer: Gauntlet reserves the right to not move forward with any parameter changes recommended in Snapshot polls, if market conditions change meaningfully.**

*By approving this proposal, you agree that any services provided by Gauntlet shall be governed by the terms of service available at gauntlet.network/tos.*

choices: Option 1: Lever A, B, C, D

decision.summary: The proposal recommends lowering the base rate to 0 for WETH on v3 markets to facilitate more Emode borrowing against LST collateral, which is expected to increase protocol revenue and improve risk profile. The timeline metrics and voting progression strongly favor Option 1, reflecting early and sustained support. Similar past proposals also recommended adjustments to interest rates to optimize borrowing and utilization, with mixed market reactions but valuable lessons on balancing risk and utilization.
key_arguments_for: Lowering slope 1 below staking yield for WETH and WMATIC will encourage more Emode borrowing, increasing revenue by an estimated $1m annually.
The change reduces dependency on declining LST liquidity for liquidations, improving protocol risk profile.
Timeline metrics show consistent and stable early support for Option 1, with a strong lead ratio and stable voter engagement.
Similar historical proposals supported lowering slope 1 and adjusting interest rates to optimize utilization and risk.
key_arguments_against: Some community members express concern that setting slope 1 too low may reduce overall protocol revenue and available liquidity.
Suggestions to automate slope 1 adjustments to better track LST yields to avoid governance lag and potential market misalignment.
Concerns about Polygon v2 deprecation and ongoing incentives suggest timing for changes should be cautious.
Forum sentiment shows some negative feedback and caution regarding current proposal specifics.

evidence.quote: Gauntlet’s analysis identifies opportunities to adjust interest rate parameters to facilitate more Emode borrowing and increase revenue. Recommendation to lower slope 1 to 3.3% for WETH and 4.3% for WMATIC.
Timeline metrics show strong and stable early lead for Option 1 with 67.8% lead ratio and stability of 67.8%.
Disagreement with lowering slope 1 below staking APY yield due to risk of equilibrium above optimal ratio and decreased revenue.
Support for lowering base interest rate to zero and maintaining slope 1 at 3.8% to increase utilization and reduce sensitivity to staking yield changes.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Option 1' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analysis indicates strong and early support for Option 1, with a stable lead ratio and voter engagement supporting the lowering of slope 1.
- Forum sentiment is mixed but leans slightly negative due to concerns about revenue impact and market timing; however, the recommendation aligns with maximizing protocol utilization and risk profile improvements.
- Similar past proposals recommended lowering slope 1 and adjusting interest rates for improved utilization, with lessons learned on risk management.
- Market and TVL impacts are positive, supporting the rationale for change despite some community reservations. The recommendation reflects a durable benefit for the protocol.
- The proposal outcome recommendation mirrors the aggregated timeline vote but diverges slightly from forum sentiment, which suggests cautious optimism.
